comments:
I was connected to dev.eclipse.org through SSH Only connection.
I tried renaming a remote file, but the ssh connection was stalled.
I had already finished entering the new name, but the cursor remained a sandclock; I guess this could be simulated in the debugger by planting a breakpoint at SftpFileService.rename().

While the cursor was still a sandclock, I selected the SSH Connection and chose "disconnect". The connection disconnected, but the tree view became inconsistent: Where I would expect the name of the files subsystem, I now saw the name of the file I wanted to rename (see attached screenshot).

Created an attachment (id=41711)
Screenshot of inconsistent RSE tree view

The Error Log shows a ClassCastException, and an SWT Widget is Disposed exception:

I'm not sure how to simulate this.  In the debugger, putting a breakpoint there will freeze the UI until running from the breakpoint.  Is there another way to reproduce this?
I haven't heard back about this so I'm going to mark it worksforme.
